post_title: European police chiefs target E2EE in latest demand for 'lawful access'
title: European Police Chiefs Seek Balance: E2EE vs. Lawful Access for Child Safety
post_content:
THE CONTINUING CRYPTO WARS: A CALL FOR RECONSIDERATION OF END-TO-END ENCRYPTION

In the ongoing saga of the crypto wars, Graeme Biggar, the director general of the UK’s National Crime Agency (NCA), has urged Meta (formerly Facebook) to rethink its implementation of end-to-end encryption (E2EE) on Instagram, citing concerns for child safety. This appeal follows a joint declaration by European police chiefs, including the UK’s, which expresses concern over the expanding use of E2EE by the tech industry and the potential impact on law enforcement’s ability to identify and act upon illegal activities.

The core of the issue lies in the balance between user privacy and the need for law enforcement agencies to access data in the pursuit of justice. Biggar, in an interview with BBC Radio 4, acknowledged the importance of encryption for cybersecurity but emphasized the need for platforms to provide law enforcement with necessary information to ensure public safety. As it stands, platforms like Meta can scan message content and provide law enforcement with critical information regarding child safety. However, the expansion of E2EE to Instagram could potentially hinder this process, leading to a decrease in the number of reports sent to police forces worldwide.

In response to these concerns, European police chiefs have called on the technology industry to find solutions that enable both robust security and privacy while maintaining the ability to identify and report illegal activities. The proposed solutions may involve client-side scanning technology, similar to Apple's shelved plan for detecting child sexual abuse material (CSAM) on users' devices. However, such measures have raised concerns about privacy, cybersecurity, and democratic freedoms, with critics suggesting that these measures may cause more harm than good.

Striking a balance between user privacy and public safety is a complex challenge that requires careful consideration and collaboration between tech companies, law enforcement agencies, and policymakers. While end-to-end encryption is crucial for protecting user data, it is equally important to ensure that law enforcement agencies retain the ability to access necessary information for investigations and prosecutions.

In this evolving landscape, it is essential for all parties to work together to develop solutions that respect user privacy while also addressing the concerns of law enforcement agencies. This may involve exploring alternative methods for identifying and reporting illegal activities, investing in advanced technologies that can detect CSAM without
meta_desc: Meta Description: Protect children with encryption, but maintain law enforcement's ability to act on illegal activities. Collaboration between tech & law enforcement needed. CryptoWars Encryption ChildSafety

post_title: A coffee roastery in Finland has launched an AI-generated blend. The results were surprising
title:
AI-Crafted Blend: Finland's Coffee Roastery Unveils AI-Powered Mixture

OR

AI Unveils a Flavor Symphony: Finland's Kaffa Roastery Introduces AI-conic Blend

These two options highlight the key points and maintain the original headline's essence while being concise and SEO-friendly.
post_content:
Title: A Symphony of Flavors: The AI-conic Coffee Blend Revolution

Artisanal coffee roastery, Kaffa Roastery, based in Helsinki, Finland, has unveiled an innovative coffee blend dubbed "AI-conic." This pioneering mixture is the result of a unique collaboration between Kaffa and local AI consultancy, Elev, utilizing artificial intelligence to create a distinctive and exciting flavor profile. 

Finland, a nation of 5.6 million people, leads the world in coffee consumption, with an impressive 12 kilograms per capita annually, according to the International Coffee Organization. Thus, it seems fitting that this groundbreaking blend was launched in a country where coffee is not only a beloved beverage but also an integral part of the culture.

The AI-conic blend is a meticulously crafted mixture of four types of beans, dominated by the velvety Fazenda Pinhal from Brazil. This ambitious project, leveraging AI models similar to ChatGPT and Copilot, aimed to create a distinctive blend tailored to coffee enthusiasts' tastes, challenging conventional flavor combinations.

Svante Hampf, Kaffa Roastery's founder and managing director, explained that the primary objective of this collaboration was to explore how AI and its various tools could assist in coffee roasting, an artisan profession deeply respected in Finland. To achieve this, descriptions of all coffee types and their flavors were provided to the AI, which was then instructed to create a new and exciting blend.

The AI-conic blend consists of beans from Brazil, Colombia, Ethiopia, and Guatemala. Interestingly, the AI selected a combination of four different beans, a choice that Hampf found surprising, as conventional blends typically use two or three types of beans to distinguish the flavors from various origins.

Upon test roasting and blind testing, Kaffa's coffee experts agreed that the AI-assisted blend was flawless, requiring no human adjustments. Antti Merilehto, Elev's spokesman, emphasized that the AI-conic blend represents a significant opportunity for AI to introduce new perspectives to seasoned professionals while offering coffee connoisseurs exciting new taste experiences.

Kaffa Roastery hopes that this trial will spark a dialogue between coffee professionals about the future of the
meta_desc: Meta Description: AI-conic coffee blend at Kaffa Roastery. Explore the future of coffee roasting with this unique, AI-generated blend. Discover a new flavor profile in Helsinki's flagship store.

post_title: This Week in AI: When 'open source' isn't so open
title:
Title: Navigating Open Source AI Complexities: A Look at Meta's Llama 3 Models

Meta's Llama
post_content:
Title: Navigating the Shifting Landscape of AI and Open Source: A Roundup of Recent Developments

Introduction

Staying current with the rapidly evolving artificial intelligence (AI) industry can be challenging. As we await AI assistance in this endeavor, here's a roundup of notable news, research, and stories in the world of machine learning. This issue focuses on the complexities surrounding open source AI models, with a closer look at Meta's Llama 3 models and the broader implications of the open source label.

Meta's Llama 3 Models: Not Quite Open Source

Meta recently unveiled its Llama 3 8B and 70B generative AI models, which can analyze and generate text. Although Meta claims these models are "open sourced," they come with licensing restrictions that limit their true openness. These limitations include the inability to train other models using Llama models and the need for special licenses for developers serving over 700 million monthly users. This raises questions about the definition of open source in the AI context—and highlights a widening philosophical debate.

The Elusive Definition of Open Source AI

The clouded definition of open source AI raises important questions about copyright, component ownership, and the actual ability to study and modify models. The Carnegie Mellon study, co-authored by researchers at Carnegie Mellon, the AI Now Institute, and the Signal Foundation, reveals that many AI models marketed as open source have hidden restrictions. These constraints include unavailable data, inaccessible compute power, and expensive labor for fine-tuning.

The Harmful Impact of Co-opting Open Source

When large tech companies like Meta label their AI projects as open source, it can lead to increased news coverage, free marketing, and strategic advantages for the companies—often without similar benefits for the broader open source community. Instead of democratizing AI, these projects can actually reinforce and expand centralized power.

Additional AI Stories of Note

- Meta updated its chatbot, Meta AI, with a Llama 3-powered backend, introducing new features, such as faster image generation and access to web search results.
- The Oversight Board, Meta's semi-independent policy council, is examining the handling of explicit, AI-generated images on the company
meta_desc:
Discover how Google's AI model, PaLM, outperforms competitors and the implications of Meta's Llama 3 models' licensing restrictions. Stay informed on AI's evolving landscape.

Meta Description:
Unveil the potential of Google's PaLM and Meta's Llama 3 models. Explore AI's shifting landscape, licensing restrictions, and their impact on open source. Stay updated.

post_title: Green search engine Ecosia launches a cross-platform browser
post_content:
Ecosia, the eco-conscious search engine, has recently launched a new cross-platform browser, aiming to expand its sustainable impact and user base. This Chromium-based browser, available for Mac, Windows, iOS, and Android, offers a familiar experience to Google Chrome users, making the transition more enticing. While Ecosia's primary focus has been search, the new browser allows the company to extend its environmental commitment to various browsing experiences.

Ecosia's Chief Product Officer, Michael Metcalf, explained their expansion into the browser market, stating, "We want to go where our users are and start to expand the footprint of where they can be sustainable." With this new platform, Ecosia introduces an affiliate shopping program, allowing users to generate clean energy and fund tree-planting initiatives while shopping online at popular retailers such as Amazon, eBay, and Decathlon.

Ecosia's sustainability efforts extend beyond its search engine and browser. The company has pledged to generate 25Wh of clean energy per user daily through affiliate revenues. Although the company acknowledges the challenge of encouraging users to switch browsers, it is targeting its existing 20 million search engine users and environmentally-conscious consumers.

In addition to its affiliate shopping program, Ecosia has made significant changes to its search engine over the past year. The company began experimenting with Google Search in select markets, moving away from its long-standing partnership with Bing. Moreover, Ecosia reached a milestone of planting over 200 million trees in more than 95,000 locales worldwide, further solidifying its dedication to environmental conservation.

In summary, Ecosia's new cross-platform browser represents a significant step in expanding the company's sustainability initiatives and user base. By offering a familiar browsing experience and integrating an affiliate shopping program, Ecosia continues to promote eco-friendly practices in various aspects of online activity.

post_title: Why vector databases are having a moment as the AI hype cycle peaks
title: Vector Databases Rise: Aiding AI in Unstructured Data Processing
post_content:
Title: The Rise of Vector Databases: A New Era of Unstructured Data Processing

Introduction

Vector databases are rapidly gaining popularity, spurred by the growth of large language models and generative AI. These databases excel in handling unstructured data, such as images and social media posts, unlike traditional relational databases that work best with structured data. By converting data into numerical representations, vector databases enable machine learning models to retrieve semantically similar data, making them invaluable for AI applications.

Understanding Vector Databases

Vector databases store and process data as vector embeddings, converting text, documents, images, and other data into numerical representations that capture meaning and relationships between data points. This spatial organization of data by relevance makes it easier to retrieve semantically similar data, ideal for large language models like OpenAI's GPT-4.

Vector search offers several benefits, including improved context understanding for AI chatbots, real-time content recommendations, and reduced "hallucinations" in LLM applications by providing additional information from external sources. Vector databases allow developers to work more efficiently with large datasets and vector embeddings, reducing the need for retraining and fine-tuning.

Growth and Investment in Vector Database Startups
meta_desc:
Discover the Vector Database Surge: Startups Rake in $100M, Giants Follow Suit

Investors have poured over $100 million into vector database startups in 2021, highlighting the technology's growing significance. This funding fuels innovation, enabling startups to compete with industry giants like Amazon, Microsoft, and Google. These tech giants are investing heavily in vector databases, integrating the technology into their AI services to enhance unstructured data processing.

The Unstructured Data Revolution: Vector Databases Take Center Stage

Vector databases tackle the challenge of processing massive volumes of unstructured data, such as images, social media posts, and text. By converting data into numerical representations, these databases empower AI models to understand context, retrieve semantically similar data, and deliver more accurate results.

post_title: Tesla layoffs, Cybertruck recalls and Serve Robotics goes public
title: Tesla Layoffs, Cybertruck Recall, Regulators Near AV Rules & Serve Robotics IPO; Deals & Reads
post_content:
Welcome to the latest edition of TechCrunch Mobility, where we bring you the most important news and insights from the dynamic world of transportation. Don't miss out - subscribe for free here.

Let's dive in!

Tesla's new chapter

Tesla has been making headlines once again. The week began with an announcement of layoffs affecting about 10% of its 140,000-strong workforce, as well as CEO Elon Musk's vow to focus on autonomy. The week ended with a recall of Tesla's Cybertruck. For more on Tesla's Semi charging corridor program, check out Sean O'Kane's exclusive scoop.

Federal regulators close to proposing AV rules

Our Washington, D.C. sources report that federal regulators are nearing the publication of a Notice of Proposed Rulemaking on autonomous vehicle (AV) regulations. This marks the first federal attempt at setting safety standards for the AV industry. The Federal Motor Carrier Safety Administration (FMCSA) is expected to release the proposal this summer or fall, which will establish minimum safety requirements for AVs operating on public roads.

Deal of the week: Serve Robotics

Serve Robotics, the Nvidia- and Uber-backed sidewalk robot delivery company, has gone public through a reverse merger. The move is expected to generate around $40 million in gross proceeds for expanding its fleet, R&D, manufacturing, and geographic expansion. Serve aims to have 2,000 robots in operation across multiple U.S. cities by 2025, generating between $60 million and $80 million in annual revenue.

Other deals that caught our attention:

1. Found Energy, a startup converting waste aluminum into hydrogen, raised a $12 million seed round.
2. Getir, a Turkish delivery company, is considering asset sales and exits from non-core markets due to investor pressure.
3. Swtch Energy, an EV charging solutions provider for apartment buildings, raised $27.2 million in a Series B round.

Notable reads and tidbits

1. Mobileye secured orders for 46 million EyeQ6 Light ADAS chips, offering improved road sens
meta_desc: "Discover Tesla's new focus on autonomy with job cuts & Cybertruck recall. Plus, federal AV rules & deals from Serve Robotics & more." (149 characters)

post_title: Women in AI: Anna Korhonen studies the intersection between linguistics and AI
title: Anna Korhonen: Pioneering Responsible NLP & Gender Balance in AI
post_content:
Title: Spotlight on Anna Korhonen: Pioneering Responsible Natural Language Processing

Introduction

In the rapidly evolving world of Artificial Intelligence (AI), women pioneers like Anna Korhonen, Professor of Natural Language Processing (NLP) at the University of Cambridge, are paving the way for a more inclusive and responsible AI landscape. With her unique interdisciplinary background in computer science and linguistics, Anna focuses on developing human-centric NLP techniques while advocating for a more balanced and safety-conscious AI industry.

Background and Inspiration

Anna's fascination with human intelligence and language led her to specialize in AI. She was drawn to the field's potential for practical applications, allowing her to combine her interests in engineering, computer science, and linguistics. Throughout her career, Anna has been driven by the mission to create AI tools that can support social and global good.

Notable Achievements

Anna takes pride in her fundamental research on NLP, which has led to the development of practical tools that can help understand complex issues such as disease development and treatment. Her work also focuses on creating applications that can improve education and support human cognitive abilities.

Challenges and Opportunities for Women in AI

Although Anna has found support in female-dominated AI sectors, she acknowledges the challenges posed by the male-dominated industry. She encourages women to actively network and help each other to achieve better gender balance in the field. Anna believes that AI desperately needs more women in leadership roles to change the current culture and better serve humanity.

Pressing Issues in AI Evolution

Anna highlights the need for a more responsible approach to AI development, emphasizing the importance of putting human needs and safety first. She encourages developers to consider potential issues, such as safety, trustworthiness, job displacement, and environmental impact, as they build AI technologies.

Responsible AI Development

To build AI responsibly, Anna recommends focusing on understanding and addressing the complex social contexts and norms that AI systems often lack. Developers should remain transparent about AI's limitations and prevent over-reliance on technology for critical decision-making.

Conclusion

Anna Korhonen's work in NLP and her advocacy for responsible AI development serve as an inspiration for those seeking to create a more inclusive and

post_content:
Title: African Startups Thrive as TLcom Capital Concludes $154M Fundraising for TIDE Africa Fund II

Introduction:

Even amid the ongoing funding winter, venture capital (VC) activity in Africa has demonstrated resilience. Major VC firms continue to back startups on the continent, with TLcom Capital, an African VC firm, being the latest to conclude its fundraising. TLcom Capital has successfully raised $154 million for its second fund, TIDE Africa Fund II, making it Africa's largest investor across seed and Series A stages.

post_title: Tinder gets a ‘Share My Date’ feature for users to send date plans to their curious friends
title: Title: Tinder's "Share My Date" Feature: Plan & Share Romantic Encounters
post_content:
Title: Tinder's "Share My Date" Feature: A New Way to Plan and Share Your Romantic Encounters

Introduction

In this digital age, it's not uncommon to share our daily lives with our friends and family, even our romantic endeavors. Online dating giant Tinder has recently introduced a new feature called "Share My Date," allowing users to share their date plans and details with others directly from the app. This innovative tool not only streamlines the process of sharing date information but also adds a layer of safety and excitement for its users.

The "Share My Date" Feature: How It Works

Tinder's "Share My Date" feature enables users to share a link containing essential details about their upcoming date. These details include the match's name, meeting location, date, and time. Users can also add a personalized note at the bottom for a more tailored experience. The links can be shared up to 30 days before the date and are editable, allowing users to make necessary adjustments whenever needed.

Recipients of the "Share My Date" link can view the date details, including non-Tinder users who will see a limited version of the match's profile containing only their photos, name, and age. This feature encourages users to involve their friends and family in their dating lives, fostering a sense of community and safety.

A Time-Honored Tradition Meets Modern Technology

Discussing dates with friends and family has long been a part of the dating ritual, and "Share My Date" aims to simplify this process. By sharing basic date information, users can focus on the exciting aspects of preparing for their romantic encounters, such as choosing the perfect outfit or planning conversation topics.

As Melissa Hobley, Tinder CMO, explains, "At Tinder, we continue to release new features that aim to create a fun, safe, and respectful experience for all... Share My Date streamlines this basic info-sharing so singles can jump right to the exciting part."

Global Rollout and Slowing Growth in the Dating App Market

The new "Share My Date" feature will roll out across several countries, including the U.S., U.K., Australia, Canada, France, Spain, Italy, Netherlands, India, Germany, Ireland, Japan, Brazil, Singapore, Switzerland, Mexico, Korea, Vietnam, and Thailand
meta_desc:
Meta Description:

Discover Tinder's new "Share My Date" feature - plan, share, and enhance your dating experience! Share date details with friends & family for a safer, more engaging romantic adventure. TinderDateShare

(112 characters)
